definitions: To invent a story, excuse, or explanation, often one that is not true.
To create or compose something, such as a song or poem.
To reconcile or become friends again after a disagreement.
To compensate for something lost, missed, or lacking.
examples: She had to make something up quickly when asked why she was late.
The band will make something up for their new album.
They decided to make something up after their argument.
He worked extra hours to make something up for the lost time.
